business.headline: Explained: Why Bajaj Housing Finance shares fell 9% todayBajaj Housing Finance stock has now slipped almost 10% in the past 5 days, 13% in the past month, 22.83% in the last 6 months, 28.85% over the past year and 41.46% over the last five years.
Sensex opens 300 points lower, Nifty below 26,200; HDFC Bank down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 132.28 points to 85,509.62, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 31.90 points to 26,143.85 as of 9:26 am.
Who is Ramakrishnan Chander, LIC's new Managing Director He joined LIC in 1990 as an Assistant Administrative Officer and has steadily moved up the ranks over the decades.

Big December IPO lineup: Key details of Meesho, Aequs, Vidya Wires and 13 othersFour mainboard IPOs — Meesho, Wakefit Innovations, Aequs and Vidya Wires are scheduled to hit the market, while a long list of SME issues will follow through the month.

India's Foreign Direct Investment up 18% in April-September, US inflows doubleThe inflow from the US more than doubled to USD 6.62 billion during the period, according to the latest government data released on Monday.

Why most early retirement plans fail: Expert breaks down the real problemMost people chasing early retirement don't fail because they earn too little, they fail because they rely on assumptions that don't hold up in real life. An expert explains where FIRE plans usually go wrong.

Airbus hit by fresh A320 production flaw as global fleet undergoes fixes: ReportThe latest snag comes just as airlines worldwide, including Indian carriers, rush through emergency software upgrades ordered after regulators flagged a flight-control vulnerability linked to solar radiation.

Govt moves to retain high taxes on tobacco, pan masala with new excise, cess billsThe Central Excise (Amendment) Bill, 2025, proposes fresh excise duties on all tobacco products, while the Health Security se National Security Cess Bill, 2025, seeks a new cess on pan masala and other notified sin goods.

Sensex, Nifty end marginally lower after hitting record highsThe S&P BSE Sensex closed 64.77 points lower at 85,641.90, while the NSE Nifty50 ended 27.20 points down at 26,175.75. Broader market indices also weakened as volatility ticked up and investors booked profits following a record-setting rally last week.

Will RBI announce a 25 bps rate cut? What to expect from the upcoming MPC meetingWith inflation staying unusually low and the economy showing strong growth, expectations of a small rate cut have gathered pace.

Will, gift deed or trust: Which is the best way to pass on your wealth?Most families believe a will is enough, but the truth is more complicated. Knowing when to use a will, gift deed or trust can determine whether your wealth transfers smoothly or breaks down in disputes.

How lifestyle inflation, not low income, is hurting your savings? Explains expertMost people blame low income for their poor savings, but financial experts point to something else entirely, i.e., lifestyle inflation. Each upgrade, no matter how small, reduces the space for savings. Is this holding you back too?

Silver hits record high as gold shines. What's behind the latest bullion rally?The precious metals market is buzzing again as silver hits a fresh record high and gold continues its steady climb. What's fuelling this powerful bullion rally?

Cancer patients in India face health insurance crisis, finds new studyCancer patients are facing a health insurance crisis. A new study finds early detection rising but coverage thinning, leaving households to manage high bills, multiple claims and growing out-of-pocket expenses.

How smart investors maintain liquidity without compromising returnsResearch shows that portfolios with disciplined liquidity management outperform those with static cash holdings during market stress.

From ITR to TDS: 4 key income tax deadlines you can't miss in DecemberWith multiple tax compliances due this month, December demands careful attention from individuals and businesses alike. These four deadlines are the ones you can't afford to miss.

Lenskart share price jumps 5% after Q2 results. Here's all you need to knowLenskart's share price climbed to nearly 5% on the Bombay Stock Exchange around 9:37 am, reflecting renewed investor confidence following one of its best quarterly performances since listing.

Sensex, Nifty scale fresh peaks as Q2 GDP surprise lifts market moodBoth the S&P BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty50 touched fresh all-time highs in early trade. By 9:24 am, the Sensex was up 309.06 points at 86,015.73, while the Nifty50 rose 84.50 points to 26,287.45.

From OTPs, KYC to e-Sign: How everyday slips are fuelling a new wave of digital fraudFraudsters no longer hack systems, they hack human behaviour, using lookalike pages, cloned voices and urgent prompts. Even routine steps like OTPs, KYC and e-Sign are becoming easy entry points. Are consumers prepared for this new kind of digital deception?
HUL's Nitin Paranjape shares dramatic account of company's 5-lakh store leapNitin Paranjpe recalled proposing the addition of five lakh outlets, a number he admitted sounded unrealistic at first.

entertainment.headline: Gotham Awards: Leonardo's One Battle After Another leads night. Full winners list Leonardo DiCaprio's One Battle After Another won Best Feature, while Jafar Panahi's It Was Just an Accident picked up three key awards, including Best Director at the Gotham Awards 2025.

Kalamkaval teaser: Superstar Mammootty looks menacing in crime thriller A new teaser for Kalamkaval has been unveiled, revealing Mammootty in an intense and enigmatic role, with the film set to release on December 5.

Ashnoor Kaur on BB 19 ouster before finale: Felt like my dream was snatched In an exclusive conversation with India Today, actor Ashnoor Kaur spoke about how her dreams got shattered after she was ousted from Bigg Boss 19, just a week before the finale.

Zootopia 2 roars at global office, smashes records in China with $272 million debut Disney's Zootopia 2 has made a spectacular start at the global box office, led by a record-breaking five-day opening in China that amassed $272 million. The film hit globally on November 26, and released in India on November 28.

Gender politics gone wrong: Aan Paavam Pollathathu's problematic worldview Rio Raj and Malavika Manoj's Aan Paavam Pollathathu faces backlash for its one-sided gender narrative. The film's portrayal raises debates on gender equality and cultural attitudes in modern relationships.

Tere Ishk Mein box office Day 4: Dhanush-Kriti film dips on Monday, earns Rs 60 crore Kriti Sanon and Dhanush's film Tere Ishk Mein has recorded a robust box office performance in its opening weekend, becoming the second highest-grossing romantic drama of the year despite a significant decline in collections on its first Monday.

What is Bhuta Shuddhi Vivaha, Samantha and Raj's sacred yogic wedding ritual? Samantha Prabhu and Raj Nidimoru's Bhuta Shuddhi Vivaha explained -- a sacred yogic wedding ritual that purifies the five elements and invokes Devi's grace.

Samantha-Raj Nidimoru timeline: Secret dating to Coimbatore wedding, story so far Actor Samantha Ruth Prabhu and filmmaker Raj Nidimoru got married at Coimbatore's Isha Yoga Centre on December 1. Their relationship evolved from a professional collaboration to a solid companionship, marking nearly two years since their first meeting.

Song Kang celebrates comeback as 13,000 attend his Japan fan event Korean actor Song Kang marks his official return to the entertainment industry with a sold-out fan-meeting tour in Japan, engaging thousands of fans and preparing for a new screen project.

What made Bigg Boss 19 work: Season that brought the reality TV show back to life Bigg Boss season 19 brought the buzz back. Real emotions, messy fights, honest friendships and unpredictable twists kept viewers hooked and social media talking all season.

Millie Bobby Brown felt safe with David Harbour, cites father-daughter bond Actor Millie Bobby Brown, in a recent interview, says she felt safe working with Stranger Things co-star David Harbour, following reports that she filed a bullying and harassment complaint against him ahead of the show's fifth season.

Scarlett Johansson stands by filmmaker Woody Allen amid sexual abuse allegations Actor Scarlett Johansson explains her continued support for Woody Allen amid controversy, discusses industry reactions, and reflects on personal principles guiding her public stance.

Ellie Goulding announces second pregnancy, flaunts baby bump at Fashion Awards Singer Ellie Goulding has confirmed she is expecting her second child, her first with boyfriend Beau Minniear, during her appearance at the 2025 Fashion Awards in London.

Jemimah Rodrigues shares BTS pics from Too Much appearance with Shafali Verma Jemimah Rodrigues shared new photos from her appearance with Shafali Verma on Kajol and Twinkle Khanna's show Too Much, where she sported a floral co-ord outfit.

Madhuri Dixit says Dr Shriram Nene didn't know she was a star when they first met Madhuri Dixit shared that her husband, Dr Shriram Nene, had no idea she was a major Bollywood star when they first met because he grew up abroad and rarely watched Indian films. She said this made their connection feel genuine, without any preconceived notions about her celebrity status.

Shahid Kapoor says his career was an accident as he opens up about nepotism claims Shahid Kapoor opened up about keeping strict boundaries between work and family, saying his Bollywood journey was never planned and calling his career "an accident." He also spoke about fatherhood, nepotism assumptions, and why he believes children should build their own identity.

Mrs Deshpande trailer: Madhuri Dixit hunts a copycat killer in gripping new series Madhuri Dixit returns to the thriller genre with Mrs Deshpande, playing a convicted serial killer who helps police hunt down a copycat murderer. The series explores a tense mother–son dynamic, dark secrets, and a gripping investigation.

Actor Chaithra Achar says Prabhas–Hanu's period drama Fauzi is on another level Kannada actor Chaithra Achar joined the cast of the highly anticipated period war drama Fauzi, marking her Telugu debut with Prabhas and an ensemble cast.

Knives Out 3 OTT release: When and where to watch Daniel Craig's mystery-thriller Daniel Craig's mystery-thriller 'Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery' is all set for its OTT release. The film is the third installment of the 'Knives Out' film series.

general news.headline: Muslims should give up Gyanvapi, Hindus must stop new demands: Ex-ASI top officialFormer Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) regional director KK Muhammed pointed out that Mathura and Gyanvapi are two other places, apart from Ram Janmabhoomi, that are "as important for the Hindu community as Mecca and Medina are for Muslims." He warned that pursuing additional claims would not resolve the issue and could lead to further conflict.

Govt wants Sanchar Saathi mandatory in all phones, what is this app, what it does?It is official. Hours after a news report surfaced about a secret memo to phone companies, the government has now confirmed that it wants Sanchar Saathi app installed on all phones in India. This is mandatory and the users will not be able to delete or disable the app. What is Sanchar Saathi? We explain.

Imran Khan supporters plan protests in Islamabad, Rawalpindi; big gatherings bannedThe protests, organised by Imran Khan's Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf party, are scheduled outside Adiala Jail in Rawalpindi, where he has been held since August 2023, and the Islamabad High Court.

Kuki-Meitei duo from strife-torn Manipur score as India make football historyIndia's U17 football team created history by qualifying for the Asian Cup in Saudi Arabia in 2026. The 2-0 victory came against soccer powerhouse Iran, and it was a Meitei and a Kuki player from strife-torn Manipur who scored for India. Even as Manipur remains divided, the united effort on the field gives hope for peace.

In all the noise, are we not enjoying Virat Kohli's greatness enough?IND vs SA, 1st ODI: Drowned in debates, numbers and noise, we often forget the simple joy of watching a master at work. Virat Kohli's innings in Ranchi cut through the clutter, urging us to pause, breathe, and just enjoy greatness.

Khaleda Zia's party thanks PM Modi for message on critically ill leaderThe BNP expressed sincere gratitude to PM Narendra Modi for his message wishing Khaleda Zia's speedy recovery. She has been placed on ventilation and remains under the supervision of a medical team that includes specialists from abroad.

Pak PM staying away to avoid notifying Munir as defence chief: Security expertSecurity analyst Tilak Devasher has said Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif is deliberately avoiding to issue the notification appointing Lt Gen Asim Munir as Chief of Defence. He suggested the delay indicates political hesitation at the top, even as pressure builds on the government to formalise the decision.

Why not say it before retiring? ASI chief slams ex-official's 'dark age' remarkLast month, in an interview with India Today, Muhammed described the last 11 years under the Narendra Modi government as a "dark age." Taking a veiled dig at him, ASI chief Yadubir Singh Rawat said, "Some people have said things years after retirement - why didn't they raise them when they were in the ASI?"
Why modern travel is leaning hard into luxuryFrom budget hotels and street food, we're now moving towards lavish stays and experimental cuisines, with luxury shaping the way we travel.
Amazon's Siddharth Bhagat Breaks Down India's New Beauty Economy—From Global Trends to Tech-Led DiscoveryTracing India's changing beauty codes.

Nanded man killed by girlfriend's family seen dancing with her father in old videoOn November 27, Saksham Tate was first shot and then his head was bludgeoned with a large stone by his girlfriend Aanchal Mamilwad's father, Gajanan, along with her brothers Sahil and Himesh and several associates. She has demanded the death penalty for her parents and brothers.

Sandeep Sharma's explanation goes viralIND vs SA: Veteran pacer Sandeep Sharma's resurfaced clip has provided a rare insight into why India continue to invest in Harshit Rana. His Ranchi spell against South Africa only boosted the selectors' belief that he is a long-term fast-bowling project worth backing.

Can Covid vaccine spike proteins linger in the body, cause aggressive cancer?A doctor's viral remark linking Covid virus and vaccine spike protein to a rise in rare cancers has triggered concern. But Indian experts call the claim biologically implausible and misleading.

Apple appoints Indian-origin veteran researcher Amar Subramanya as new AI chiefApple has named Amar Subramanya as its new AI vice president, signalling a strategic shift in its AI ambitions. This move comes amid delays in AI features and leadership changes within the company.

Watch: Defiant Maduro dances to 'Peace, yes. War, no' amid rising US pressureOn Monday, hundreds of thousands of Nicolas Maduro's supporters, waving Venezuelan flags, attended the ceremony at the Presidential Palace. The crowd erupted in loud cheers as the 63-year-old, wearing a red cap reminiscent of the MAGA baseball cap, broke into dance.

Kalamkaval teaser: Superstar Mammootty looks menacing in crime thrillerA new teaser for Kalamkaval has been unveiled, revealing Mammootty in an intense and enigmatic role, with the film set to release on December 5.

Harvard isn't number 1? These US colleges are dominating career outcomesPrinceton and Duke top LinkedIn's 2025 list of US colleges delivering strong long-term career outcomes. With graduates largely entering tech, finance, and consulting, the rankings also show Harvard in sixth place, underscoring how the choice of college can significantly influence career trajectories.

Hegseth, with Trump's help, distances from row over 2nd strike on Venezuelan boatThe White House defended the legality of a September strike on a suspected Venezuelan drug boat, even as President Trump had said he would not have wanted a second strike that reportedly killed survivors.

Live: Voting begins; 246 Councils, 42 Nagar Panchayats go to polls todayMaharashtra Local Body Election Live Updates: Maharashtra will witness the first phase of the local body elections on Tuesday, with voting scheduled across 264 municipal councils and nagar panchayats. The main battle is between the ruling BJP-led Mahayuti alliance and the opposition Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA), though several places are set to witness friendly contests among allies. Polling began at 7.30 am and will conclude at 5.30 pm, with counting slated for tomorrow. A total of 6,042 seats and 264 council president posts are at stake. Stay tuned to IndiaToday.in for the latest updates.

What did Rohit Sharma say after Virat Kohli's Ranchi hundred? Arshdeep revealsArshdeep Singh revealed what Rohit Sharma said after Virat Kohli's hundred in Ranchi against South Africa. Rohit's reaction from the dressing room had gone viral after the star batter got to the landmark.

Why was Nitish Reddy picked? R Ashwin slams India squad selection for SA series R Ashwin has slammed the Indian squad selection for the South Africa series, as he questioned why Nitish Kumar Reddy is unable to find a spot in the playing XI. Nitish wasn't part of the side that defeated South Africa in the Ranchi ODI.

Green headlines 1355-player IPL 2026 auction list, Maxwell opts out: Reports Cameron Green and Steve Smith headline a group of major international and Indian names registered for the IPL 2026 mini-auction, scheduled for December 16 in Abu Dhabi. However, Glenn Maxwell has decided to opt out of the upcoming auction.

Not the first tough spell, nor the last: Fowler and James trust Liverpool's revival Liverpool legends Robbie Fowler and David James have urged calm despite the champions' difficult run. Both believe the club has enough resilience and quality to recover once key players return and stability returns to the squad.

England have set plans to handle Travis Head if he opens in Brisbane: Brydon Carse England enter the Brisbane Test searching for answers after Travis Head's explosive century in Perth. Brydon Carse insists the visitors have clear plans ready if the Australian left-hander opens again in the second Ashes Test.

Lamine Yamal is not trying to be Lionel Messi: My football is about fun Barcelona talisman Lamine Yamal has said that he is not trying to mimic Lionel Messi. In a bold interview, Yamal explained that Messi knows very well that he is not attempting to copy the latter's legacy at Barcelona.

Ranchi airport cheers for Team India as the victorious team leaves city. Video IND vs SA: The Ranchi airport cheered in unison for the Indian team as they left for Raipur for their second ODI of the series. The Indian team emerged victorious against South Africa in Sunday's game.

Sports minister set for special meeting with ISL, I-League clubs and stakeholders With Indian football stuck in a commercial and structural deadlock, the sports ministry has stepped in. Mansukh Mandaviya's meeting with ISL and I-League stakeholders on December 3 may shape the immediate future of domestic competitions.

Mansukh Mandaviya's meeting with ISL and I-League stakeholders on December 3 may shape the immediate future of domestic competitions.

After World Cup heroics, Railways hands promotion to injured star Pratika RawalInjured World Cup hero Pratika Rawal has been handed a promotion by her employer Indian Railways. She was promoted from the position of senior clerk to the officer rank.

Red Bull apologises for slanderous Kimi Antonelli comments in Qatar GPF1: Red Bull made a public apology to Mercedes' Kimi Antonelli for making slanderous remarks against the driver in the final moments of the Qatar GP. Max Verstappen's race engineer had alleged that Antonelli had willingly conceded a position to Lando Norris.

Hardik Pandya returns from injury to play domestic cricket for Baroda in SMATHardik Pandya's long injury layoff is set to end with his return for Baroda in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. His domestic comeback will determine how quickly he can slot back into India's T20I plans.

Did Virat Kohli avoid Gautam Gambhir after Ranchi ODI?IND vs SA: Is there a tension brewing between two of India's most senior players and Gautam Gambhir? Eagle-eyed fans have spotted Virat Kohli potentially snubbing Gambhir after the 1st ODI.

Shubman Gill begins rehab ahead of South Africa T20IsIND vs SA: Shubman Gill's return to action now hinges on his COE fitness clearance after a three-week injury layoff. India await the medical report with the South Africa T20Is approaching quickly.

Travis Head ready to open in Brisbane amid Usman Khawaja's fitness concernsTravis Head is ready to open again in the second Ashes Test in Brisbane if required. His comments come amid fitness concerns for Usman Khawaja for the pink-ball Test.

Enjoy Rohit and Virat's cricket, stop worrying about World Cup: PathanIND vs SA: Former India cricketer Irfan Pathan wants the fans to enjoy the cricket of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, instead of worrying about their eligibility for the 2027 ODI World Cup. Pathan heaped praise on the senior batters after India's win over South Africa in the 1st ODI.

Don't know why Mohammed Shami is still not playing: Kaif says India misses pacerMohammed Kaif questioned Mohammed Shami's absence from India's squad for the ODI series against South Africa. Kaif felt that Shami's experience could have helped India's young pace unit.

Dale Steyn hails Kohli's work ethic at 37: People of his age hate leaving homeDale Steyn praised Virat Kohli's relentless commitment and physical fitness after the Indian batter's 52nd ODI hundred led India to victory in the opening match against South Africa in Ranchi.

Felt like we went back 8-9 years: India teammates in awe of Kohli's Ranchi knockVirat Kohli's India teammates were left in awe of the star batter after his vintage hundred during the Ranchi ODI against South Africa on Sunday, November 30. Kohli scored his 52nd ODI hundred to help India win the match.

Lucas Paqueta slams FA after red card for lack of support in spot-fixing probeLucas Paqueta condemned the FA's lack of psychological support following his red card against Liverpool. The midfielder, recently cleared of spot-fixing allegations, linked his on-pitch behaviour to the mental toll from the investigation.

IPL 2026: Chinnaswamy games in doubt as government orders safety clearanceThe Indian Premier League matches in Bengaluru are under cloud with the government ordering safety clearances for the M Chinnaswamy stadium. The move comes after the infamous stampede incident earlier this year.

Praggnanandhaa becomes co-leader at London Chess Classic OpenGM Praggnanandhaa and Velimir Ivic share the lead at the London Chess Classic Open 2025 after six rounds. The duo is set to face-off next in the seventh round.

Usman Khawaja doesn't need advice to turn around form slump: Marnus LabuschagneMarnus Labuschagne has backed Usman Khawaja as the Australian opener is currently going through a rough patch of form. Khawaja's position in the team has been questioned after his horrendous run in 2025.

F1 title showdown: How Norris, Verstappen and Piastri can win title in Abu DhabiThe Formula One 2025 season is set for a thrilling climax as Lando Norris, Max Verstappen and Oscar Piastri battle it out for the crown. Here's how all three drivers can walk away with the crown in the Abu Dhabi GP on December 7.

Don't judge Ruturaj Gaikwad for low scores until you make him open: Aakash ChopraAakash Chopra has called for giving Ruturaj Gaikwad a chance as an opener before judging his ODI career. The former cricketer also criticised the management for benching Rishabh Pant in the first ODI against South Africa in Ranchi.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
